## Description
Expose TMDB and OMDb API keys via CLI flags and environment variables for metadata refresh operations.

## Technical Requirements
- Environment variable support (TMDB_API_KEY, OMDB_API_KEY)
- CLI flag overrides (--tmdb-api-key, --omdb-api-key)
- Secure storage in configuration
- API key validation
- Rate limit handling

## Implementation Details
1. Update configuration schema
2. Add CLI flag parsing
3. Implement secure storage
4. Add validation endpoints
5. Update metadata refresh logic

## Configuration Options
- Environment variables (highest priority)
- CLI flags (override config file)
- Configuration file (persistent storage)
- Default fallback (limited requests)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] API keys can be set via environment variables
- [ ] CLI flags override environment variables
- [ ] Keys are stored securely (not in plain text)
- [ ] Invalid keys show helpful error messages
- [ ] Rate limits are handled gracefully
- [ ] Documentation explains configuration methods
- [ ] API key validation endpoint works
- [ ] Metadata refresh uses configured keys
- [ ] Unit tests cover all configuration paths
- [ ] Integration tests verify API communication

## Security Requirements
- Keys are never logged in plain text
- Configuration files have restricted permissions
- API keys are redacted in error messages
- Audit log tracks key usage

## Error Handling
- Clear messages for missing keys
- Specific errors for invalid keys
- Rate limit exceeded notifications
- Fallback behavior documented

## Testing Requirements
- Unit tests for configuration loading
- Integration tests with mock APIs
- Security tests for key storage
- Rate limit handling tests
